definition: Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
to describe sth as/an analogy/a simile/a metaphor/an allegory

sentences.english: Simile makes the finishing point in Chinese and English.
sentences.chinese: 在英漢語言中，明喻都起到了畫龍點睛的作用。

sentences.english: The body parts are best compared in similes .
sentences.chinese: 身體的部份用明喻直接作最佳的對照。

sentences.english: You will find you can use similes and metaphors to create powerful images.
sentences.chinese: 你將會發現運用明喻和暗喻能創造出強有力的圖像。

sentences.english: Back to thinking about the battlefield, there is a simile I can give you.
sentences.chinese: 追念戰爭，我能賜與你們一個明喻的講法。

sentences.english: Neither can the mind be explained by similes and parables.
sentences.chinese: 思想也不能被明喻和寓言闡明。

sentences.english: So think of the article on Milton's similes by Geoffrey Hartman.
sentences.chinese: 想一想傑弗裏哈特曼關於彌爾頓的明喻寫的文章。

sentences.english: There are many dari ng similes in this book.
sentences.chinese: 這本書中使用了很多明喻。

sentences.english: As white as snow" is a good example of a simile.
sentences.chinese: “潔白如雪”是一個明喻的好例子。

sentences.english: Common language of metaphor and simile form of metaphor.
sentences.chinese: 語常見的比喻形式有明喻和隱喻。

sentences.english: This is the simile of what I have just given to you.
sentences.chinese: 不過這是我已經賜與你們的明喻。

sentences.english: In addition to similes, Marx employs a lot of metaphors in Capital.
sentences.chinese: 在資本論中不僅有大量明喻，而且還有許多隱喻。

definition: to use sth as a metaphor
pun/play on words/a phrase with a double meaning
